title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Poires [Pears], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service], 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Poires [Pears], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon on pink/tan paper, mounted on gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink on mount, lower center:  Les Poires
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: A garden scene depicting pear trees (right) with stone wall and gate (left middle ground).  A gardener talks with a young woman while pointing to two children trying to reach the pears on tree limbs hanging outside the gate.  He appears to be telling her to stop them from stealing his pears.  A tall ladder with basket (right foreground) leans against a tree.  A rake and pear-filled basket (left foreground) lie on a dirt path.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Poires [Pears], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service], 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon on pink/tan paper, mounted on gray paper. 
1989-13-9
